unnormalised: **Automotive Sector Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches**
normalised: The Indian automotive landscape is set for a dynamic third quarter, with manufacturers unveiling a range of new vehicles, spanning electric, C N G, and petrol variants. Doctor Aruna Sharma, head of automotive engineering at I I T Madras, highlights the crucial role of B S V I Phase two compliance in these launches, ensuring lower emissions. Expected launches include a facelifted Maruti Suzuki Brezza, rumored to incorporate a stronger hybrid system for enhanced fuel efficiency. Mahindra is also anticipated to showcase their Thar five-door variant, offering more practicality for family-oriented buyers. Tata Motors is reportedly working on an extended-range version of their popular Nexon E V, potentially boasting a range of over four hundred and fifty kilometer. New features focusing on safety, like advanced driver-assistance systems (A D A S), are also expected. Industry analysts predict a surge in demand, particularly during the Diwali season. With investments in showrooms covering approximately five thousand square feet, dealers are preparing for increased footfall. The success of these launches will depend heavily on pricing, with many hoping for competitive rates under rupee ten lakh. These developments underscore the auto sector's commitment to innovation and sustainability.
